8DEDA7F02A104364BC73171A6D1F451B.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

EDA87C854ADF4EB38AB766BB42670F67.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer.

CE77E1292DE747A285341CBAFDDF3271.description: Update artifacts (e.g., resume and evidences of learning) within one’s career portfolio following the work placement

D70FAFC6E5AB418697376C7EF65DA508.description: Summarize the work placement experience by considering things such as: interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; personal accomplishments; learnings about oneself; learnings about the world of work; learnings about careers in the workplace; and, personal demonstration of skills, abilities and understandings.

77D0206760A4490F8CA9C09BE1BD723F.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; the presence of workplace hazards and how they were addressed; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship and partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

6D79B8823A4948C69B83424198FCD3D0.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

4D284008A03C4FABB9246DA1029EAC51.description: Document observations of employment standards, workplace ethics, privacy, culture, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking during the work placement.

35FF28F655904994B25C91E2111509BF.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools such as vlogs, blogs, log sheets and reflective journals to summarize and reflect on items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être’; and, transferable skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance ones’ employability

87A2244FA7344ECC83B210C8E32AD821.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

BFD840ED3A054FE6BFA30BB8E3E8FAE6.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

2078E1DE18CA411FACE0C3D29C00587B.description: Reflect on one’s performance during the interview.

48C90549716148C0A7C1DE02E3058A05.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

6D83AF4FC5F54DCE80CA609FDAC7F739.description: Develop a list of questions that might be asked by the employer in the preplacement interview and prepare answers for them.

3D1C47A66C1845CEA77DA4C52D9071FA.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours? Who is my supervisor? What should I wear? What personal grooming standards are expected? When will I be provided with safety training?

FAABB1CC2C17496EB3917E554CE66B01.description: Describe how factors such as one’s educational and other experiences including paid, unpaid and volunteer work; self-concept; personality; needs; values; interests; knowledge; skills; attitudes; and career goals and plan might impact one’s contribution in the workplace.

3D7026AAA09D40EA94FF139E7DEF18FF.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents (e.g., permission forms, logs and self- and employer- evaluation forms) needed for the work placement

AAB8BCEEF25A49E7B7380243DD1DBF0F.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; • guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

AC0FEE19F20D4A2A81428B1F74E3F2FE.description: Update personal career artifacts (e.g., resume and cover letter) as required for the work placement, and provide to the work placement employer.

5936F2A8699048FA837546C842526B80.description: Prepare for the work placement experience.

7B209ED81B924FE0B500B42B08661FDA.description: Develop personal and learning goals for the work placement in consultation with the parent or guardian, teacher or other school staff member and employer.

A07C1D247E414666B6AC57FE2A7F5B06.description: Reflect on one’s right to know, right to participate and right to refuse while in the work placement.

1BB18522AAE04FA388E8EE02B5C98969.description: Identify employment standards (e.g., use of a uniform) that may pertain to one’s work placement.

476F5B5FFF8A4B07BE508FCC38E7985D.description: Compose a list of questions related to workplace hazards and safety to ask of the work placement employer such as: • What physical, chemical, ergonomic or biological hazards should I be aware of in my work placement?, When will I receive job safety training and orientation before I begin work?,  Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear or other clothing am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?,  How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person? • Where are safety notices posted? • What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

BD90CAC5E276445AB1A8E32EBDF948C0.description: Identify safety hazards that could potentially be encountered during the work placement experience

476D8E835C7D43909A9BDB7B3A79CB33.description: Role-play scenarios that may be encountered during the work placement such as: providing customer/client service; collaborating with colleagues; dealing with a disagreement; and, expressing one’s perspective or opinion on a matter.

0BE9AF7D4262403A9569325854616119.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

4F6E1007059449FAB91E581C9A2BB737.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent or guardian, teacher or other school staff and employer) involved in the work placement.

3ED98E8CE6184CAE9DD2BE78A8B01032.description: Explore factors that contribute to a successful work placement experience.

AE4FCA0FE2BB4E789949196FC7ED33C5.description: Identify strategies for dealing with a payroll error.

2406ED7B93514F4B8EF50F62E4190D9D.description: Calculate gross pay for various earning situations such as contract, hourly and commission.

B045EB85F9094E2A80313A887EB2635C.description: Differentiate among deductions that are required (i.e., income tax, Canadian Pension Plan and Employment Insurance), allowable (e.g., employee contributions to pension plans; charitable donations voluntarily made by an employee; and volunteer employee purchases from the employer for goods, services or merchandise) and illegal (e.g., deductions for alleged theft, damages, breakages and poor quality work).

936636630981475D9BF56B2641A50CA6.description: Identify the information that must be listed on a pay stub or statement of earnings as required by law (i.e., Part II Employment Standards in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019).

52A40534943E44FD9935B88AF47A4025.description: Discuss methods of payment such as direct deposit, cash and cheque.

889DFA538E1E4BC9BD1E5FCE9DB45652.description: Differentiate among the various types of pay periods for employees such as weekly, bi-weekly, semi-monthly and monthly, and discuss their impact on personal budgeting.

B46C768043A64B5EB5BB904C8AFDE9EE.description: Analyze components of a pay stub.

37BCCBFBE60540BAB639592C6EBFEB84.description: Role-play a variety of scenarios that require one to evaluate hazardous materials and respond appropriately.

A3FF45C806344CBFA4EEA010DB6282AA.description: Describe the usefulness of Safety Data Sheets (SDS) in helping to control hazardous materials.

EAF353784CAD47249ECC42F93351D19A.description: Identify the 16 sections of a Safety Data Sheet (SDS).

A922588084F74B079014C6A742E18619.description: Describe the purpose and contents of current hazard pictograms.

FC099FD221794D68B79EC5322AB634A3.description: Differentiate between the supplier label and workplace label.

0B951F03D1E243FCA675F87742E63D11.description: Describe the two main types of WHMIS 2015 labels (i.e., supplier and workplace).

502FDE6E220843FC82166B6C0CABEB2B.description: Identify the roles and responsibilities of the employer, worker, and supplier in relation to the safe handling of hazardous materials.

9AA959F3DD084B5DAB9C1C577F6A350A.description: Define the four parts of WHMIS 2015 (i.e., hazard identification and product classification; labels with warning symbols; Safety Data Sheets (SDS); and worker education and worksite specific training) that help workers handle hazardous materials safely.

F62FA73D11364B60A4CB9B8F722B5875.description: Describe the hierarchy of controls that is standard practice in the workplace for minimizing and eliminating exposure to hazards, including: Elimination (i.e., physically removing the hazard); Substitution (i.e., replacing the hazard); Engineering controls (i.e., isolating people from the hazard); Administrative controls (i.e., changing the way work is performed); and, Personal Protective Equipment (i.e., protecting the worker with Personal Protective Equipment).

DDB85ECF405D44D6BF1834D2278B82A6.description: Discuss factors that determine the required level of workplace specific training in WHMIS 2015.

4F0F87352CBA417D9F8F4ABAE0D779CA.description: Differentiate between general education and workplace training in regards to WHMIS 2015.

544C4A7055F14BE2BFEC6399F4D6E3DC.description: Discuss what the Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) is and its purpose and scope in the workplace.

147B17F516544D9A8CB1D4A7E1D28D03.description: Explore the Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS).

18DD41320297464E8F26B0508F9DD1FE.description: Workplace Safety – Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS)

FDCB47567D3A448FAF3E10F2FB7A60F0.description: Discuss the need for health and safety legislation and regulations.

2DC2349486B34787B635EC0A6F15251A.description: Identify employer responsibilities in relation to safety hazards.

051132EE26244BE4A33AD5A390FB0BB1.description: Explain health and safety regulations common to a specific occupation of interest.

21B9511AE196477C88B05374C5D381DA.description: Describe current prevention programs or agencies (e.g., Mission Zero, Work Safe Saskatchewan and Saskatchewan Safety Council) in Saskatchewan that are designed to raise awareness of and prevent workplace incidents.

41D1DF92D7A84360B597B8346C0F9064.description: Explore safety statistics related to young workers in the workplace in Saskatchewan and Canada and compare the statistics to those of workers in other age brackets.

D863822F1A674EF2A915298855E9B443.description: Identify potential safety hazards in a variety of environments including home, school, and workplace.

F5FCD376137942C6BA4104C78DD62119.description: Discuss the importance of proper orientation, training, appropriate supervision, workplace inspections and following safe work practices, and provide examples of each for a variety of industries.

81653EC1F4344D5B917D0CD9697805C0.description: Describe employers’ and employees’ rights and responsibilities pertaining to workplace hazards and how they can work together to prevent workplace hazards.

0B5CB7CBA03144D6B824D198254E64FA.description: Provide examples of potential workplace hazards in the five major categories.

16FB1B51EF2A4A1C9A408ACEB9F5BF40.description: Differentiate among the four Occupational Health and Safety (OHS) hazard categories including physical (e.g., heavy lifting, repetitive motion, slipping/tripping, working at heights, working alone, cuts and burns), chemical (e.g., chemicals, fumes, vapours and gases), biological (e.g., viruses, fungi, bacteria, mold; bodily fluids; sewage; animal/pet waste; and influenza), and psychological (e.g., harassment and bullying, stress, fatigue and shift work).

B58BB6145D714B3CA7BF27680E2E06BD.description: Differentiate between a workplace hazard and risk.

4A66C2F524604FE09DCDC850422845EB.description: Discuss how a workplace injury might affect the injured worker and others such as the employer, supervisor, work colleagues, family and friends.

C6D04905B7E1494BA7E6E719AD8346E4.description: Explore workplace hazards and injury prevention.

BC98F46FBA05481A855CAA270D9CF263.description: Workplace Safety – Hazards and Injury Prevention (Core)

9114F53285114B0F9D39DF3463E75713.description: Discuss the importance of reporting workplace incidents, dangerous occurrences, injuries, or illnesses immediately and the proper procedure to do so.

779A954633AD4F05A25601F060D236C9.description: Investigate how workers can participate in and support health and safety activities in the workplace. (e.g., Occupational Health and Safety Committees, professional development, training and following safety procedures).

B78D074A6EDA475C9C7D93584429372C.description: Explain the purpose of The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019 and associated Regulations, and how they affect safe workplace practices

2340CA6B70F44FB8A55FA1986E7417D6.description: Role-play scenarios to demonstrate how to properly refuse potentially unsafe work.

C881D62F9BD34C398D7D7988380172B9.description: Discuss steps that can be taken to refuse potentially unsafe work.

D15348418055434ABFC85DF3C0582C6F.description: Research employer and worker responsibilities with respect to health and safety standards as required by law in Saskatchewan.

B6735AC760314DF09E126B47E2B4B0DF.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know - the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate - in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse - work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

9598105DC3554101A91B2990B6FAADE2.description: Analyze the importance of rights and responsibilities in relation to workplace safety.

44151A44279541BEAF08DEC63FFE2E34.description: Propose resolutions to workplace conflict as represented in a variety of scenarios.

1F0100D1CBB4445981945DE94D023D78.description: Discuss and suggest ways to address conflict situations that may occur in the workplace.

14F49F05580C434BB7C20F2B806B22DC.description: Brainstorm a list of questions new employees should ask employers before beginning work, and role-play appropriate ways to ask them. Questions may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, What is my wage?, How and when will I be paid?, What deductions will be made from my pay cheque? Who is my supervisor?

DB5CFA71E25045018DB2A82E5A17AB57.description: List fair workplace practices covered by The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019.

801195BBC99348AA9B08CC96A7B49FD3.description: Describe individual’s rights and responsibilities with respect to fair treatment in the workplace as outlined by the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms and the Saskatchewan Human Rights Code

C2E3C582879E492BB5D5A479CCA2C335.description: Explore fair and cooperative workplace practices and procedures.

94C41B2BAC3149C28EBE52C1F5CE2481.description: Investigate work placement opportunities in one’s community based on the results from personal inventories.

67645A8A4B2B4BA6A24350F15976FB4F.description: Reflect on how results from personal inventories connect to perceptions of self and potential career opportunities.

762D7DBD570D4D79A3A2D891CD80F3AC.description: Complete personal inventories to determine one’s values, learning styles, interests, personality, emotional intelligence, strengths, multiple intelligences and/or virtues

31EC9EA2CF21498586CA1BD19A015ACC.description: Analyze how a variety of factors influence career decisions and planning.

C2A81E09D1274BD692F2116C16D277FC.description: Identify transferable skills that are common to many industry sectors.

022B3336DAF9438E893A51D3E3B44636.description: Discuss how political, environmental, economic, technological and other factors can impact industry sectors.

3657DE15A1324001BFAEBE070E603F08.description: Provide examples of occupations and job opportunities within each sector at all three levels.

BE0F035A7EF04E9A8B3DFEEACE3DA9DE.description: List the main industry sectors at the local, provincial and national levels.

A1BAE9790BF7449580D84A7D3D9C9A33.description: Research various ways of classifying and organizing occupations, including the National Occupational Classification (NOC) tool and the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS).

02DDE6BA6990478FB1B48651472927A9.description: Compare the types of career information available through a variety of sources.

FE768B02179D4B3DA09A93A1B451B2A7.description: Compare the types of career information available through a variety of sources.

928608892FAB432AA02A665879151B72.description: Identify a variety of sources of career information (e.g., online job sites, social media sites, local career centres, regional colleges, post-secondary institutions, online career planning programs, government agencies, newcomer centres, print publications, peers and adults) and how they can support career development.

FF76145ED74F4BAF8581A49ECF4330A6.description: Research sources of career information found within one’s school.

69C94EC080A1416596D92896A84BB6CA.description: Discuss how to determine if a source of career information is considered credible.

9F3AA875E89D4D70A7BEF82F592470B0.description: Access and assess sources of career information.

C9B3F7655DF941EFA9C8A7895A9DB4AF.description: Discuss the mutual benefits of contributing to and receiving support from a network.

A6AA71AEDD44403AA6D616EFF67D2CFC.description: List the advantages and disadvantages of networking with a variety of allies.

0FC1FC1482F04D54997D3FF881C26C7E.description: Describe ways (e.g., volunteering, job shadows and informational interviews) to build and expand networks.

9324D46167994675B462F231F6E042FE.description: Identify potential allies (e.g., people, groups, businesses, post-secondary institutions and training institutions) that could be a part of one’s network to support at least one career development interest.

34ED0D6384ED468EA27C2C0A9E048480.description: Discuss how online and social media activity as well as one’s digital identity can positively and negatively impact such things as employment status, employability and career opportunities.

44DAD7F822A14389B89496BC7ECA81BE.description: Recognize how networking can impact one’s career opportunities and support one’s career journey.

F2E3D6C56AEE4324A0B6B3E645C588C4.description: Describe one’s personal, social and career networks by answering questions such as: Whom do I know?, What do I do outside of school?, What opportunities exist or could exist because of these networks?

B5F6F215C61B43E79E86A3178E64BC95.description: Differentiate among personal, social and career networks.

C4410D1C60A840E88C3A911125B090F4.description: Explore the potential impact of networking on one’s career journey.

B157870CB2E3462CBCE056D29A3E8375.description: Research the concept of non-traditional careers and provide examples relevant to one’s community, province and country

2CD663268D0747E2B5073828044A19AD.description: Reflect on questions such as: Why do people work?, Why do people choose a particular occupation?, What are my career goals and how will I achieve them?, Why do I want to or not want to pursue a particular career?

53134DBE348942FC9B4E491B3AAF316B.description: Discuss how being employed or volunteering supports positive mental health and engaged citizenship.

1F12B51B9C534A03B5E30A3775D114BE.description: Generate a list of jobs in one’s community and classify them according to the types of work.

B7C11C9EAD5D4F5EA08D9BE218D5E939.description: Discuss when and why individuals might engage in each type of work.

C795E3F667A4468F9C4405A979B7D981.description: Differentiate between types of work such as full-time, part-time, seasonal, contract, gig, casual, shift, self-employment, entrepreneurship and volunteer.

543C03780C5B44A987092C9E3F0F6537.description: Explore how on-line platforms and social media tools can be used to develop and/or organize career artifacts

8FA1275E8F474EB69F4B0FFDFE6B581B.description: Describe the process and rationale for editing or modifying career artifacts (e.g., documents such as a cover letter or resume) to suit the needs of a specific job application.

38099DD6D5AA4B27B583976EA1720926.description: Reflect on the content within one’s career portfolio to answer questions such as: Who am I?, What are my strengths and weaknesses, How have I demonstrated my talents, skills and abilities?, What are some of my accomplishments both in and out of school?, What are my interests?

0AE031B3FC4A4058A9751B0CC57FCC20.description: Develop one’s career portfolio that includes a resume, cover letter and other relevant artifacts.

BD079754A229438BB506DE7E6B2FD520.description: Discuss the benefits of having separate personal and career portfolios for school, career goals, personal life and work.

DE2DCACE908B4FB5BD925B279F7ABC4B.description: Discuss common steps (e.g., collecting, reflecting and selecting) for determining artifacts that should be included in a career portfolio.

96BEB32871084B2D992B505CEDFABFFD.description: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of organizing one’s career artifacts in a print or online/digital portfolio.

07FF157E4B264AD1A36615E4C382D3AA.description: Generate a list of the types of artifacts (e.g., certificates, examples of school work/projects, photographs, videos, blogs, vlogs, personal web sites, awards, resume, cover letter and micro-credentials) that showcase one’s accomplishments, strengths, talents, skills, traits, abilities, interests, education and training.

A21B683EE07B4C0B885528DC56D88A9D.description: Reflect upon personal accomplishments, strengths, talents, skills, traits, abilities, interests, education and training as the basis for the development and organization of one’s career artifacts.

67BDCC26730E488A88A2F43C7C4E2706.description: Discuss how transferable skills might evolve and change throughout one’s career journey.

18AB8744B4044EDD8F302EF3BB166062.description: Explore and discuss ways to develop and improve upon one’s skill set while still in high school.

E20419F495AE4E3E84BDCAFBBD34E09A.description: Analyze local and provincial employment advertisements found in a variety of sources (e.g., online, print and social media) for common job requirements, including skills.

6E979F88575846F2B305CF53107BC903.description: Discuss opportunities to enhance one’s transferable skills through leisure activities.

969E873AAE6D4AFFAF9D4AE0F74D9B8A.description: Explore volunteer activities within the community and discuss the opportunities they provide for enhancing one’s transferable skills.

6A5960F4CCCE4D5EB57D7FE5DA0EBFDF.description: Showcase one’s transferable and soft skills in a personal career portfolio.

0D5930BB624A491D846F4EA8EC891384.description: Compare transferable skills to soft skills.

BF08548B39C545D7A30B0601AED39C62.description: Compare the skills described by the Employability Skills and the skills described by the Essential Skills taxonomies which were developed by the Conference Board of Canada and Human Resources and Service Development Canada respectively.

46E59F2791794E87AF3DBE178208988C.description: Explain the term transferable skills and provide examples of transferable skills within the context of specific occupations or jobs

EFCF8FE792B14349B7B0276C79F8A665.description: Discuss potential future experiences that will have an impact on one’s lifelong career journey.

DBA54FFD77044FFBB95C455724CAA84F.description: Reflect on the career journey to date for self and a trusted adult

23F4451EE0C349F4B5C98203B00E6415.description: Describe the three levels (i.e., awareness, exploration and experiential) of the career/life development process.

C02345F5CC4D46408805CEBA54B2F7C5.description: Differentiate between job, occupation and career.

34C7A312888446C381EF9619B1F85B6B.description: Discuss career/life development as a non-linear and life-long process
